facts.fact_text: The S&P Global UK Construction PMI rose to 46.4 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global UK Construction PMI rose to 46.4 in January 2026

facts.fact_text: December’s UK Construction PMI was 40.1, a five-and-a-half-year low.

evidences.evidence_text: rebounding from December’s five-and-a-half-year low of 40.1

facts.fact_text: The January 2026 UK Construction PMI exceeded market expectations of 42.0.
The January 2026 UK Construction PMI was the strongest reading since June 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: While this marked the strongest reading since June 2025

facts.fact_text: House building was the weakest-performing segment in the UK construction sector.

evidences.evidence_text: House building was the weakest-performing segment

facts.fact_text: Total new orders in the UK construction sector fell at the slowest rate in three months.

evidences.evidence_text: Total new orders fell at the slowest rate in three months

facts.fact_text: Employment in the UK construction sector continued to decline at a marked pace.

evidences.evidence_text: employment continued to decline at a marked pace

facts.fact_text: Input price inflation in the UK construction sector accelerated to a four-month high.

evidences.evidence_text: input price inflation accelerated to a four-month high

facts.fact_text: Business optimism in the UK construction sector improved to its strongest level since May 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Business optimism improved to its strongest level since May 2025

claims.claim_text: The UK Construction PMI signaled a continued contraction in construction activity.

evidences.evidence_text: the index signaled a continued contraction in construction activity

claims.claim_text: Total new orders falling at the slowest rate in three months suggests early signs of stabilization in the UK construction sector.

evidences.evidence_text: Total new orders fell at the slowest rate in three months, suggesting early signs of stabilization

claims.claim_text: Confidence in the UK construction sector remained well below its long-term average.

evidences.evidence_text: but confidence remained well below its long-term average
